title: March - A month of RIAA boycotting, and independent music supporting.
body: <p><img src="http://cache.gizmodo.com/assets/resources/2007/02/riaaboycott.jpg" alt="boycott RIAA" style="float: right;" />Inspired by <a href="http://gizmodo.com/gadgets/riaa-boycott/">Gizmodo's</a> <a href="http://gizmodo.com/gadgets/home-entertainment/putting-our-money-where-our-mouths-are-boycott-the-riaa-in-march-239281.php">RIAA boycott</a>, I decided to check out some <a href="http://www.riaaradar.com/zeitgeist_topamazonsafe.asp">RIAA-free music on Amazon</a>. To be honest, I didn't realize how many artists/albums I liked were in the Top 100 (aside from the ones below: Röyksopp, Andrea Bocelli, Skinny Puppy). I haven't spent this much money on music since <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/archive/2004/06/08/allofmp3_com.aspx">AllOfMp3</a> took credit cards. Here's what I ended up getting:</p><dl><dt style="clear:both;"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/B000F3AAUW/dieselhome-20/ref=nosim">Gnarls Barkley - St. Elsewhere</a></dt><dd><img src="http://ec2.images-amazon.com/images/P/B000F3AAUW.01._AA240_SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpg" alt="St. Elsewhere album cover" style="float: right;" />I've been a fan of Dangermouse since the Grey Album. The song <em>Crazy</em> has been stuck in my head for awhile and at $9.99, this one's pretty much a no-brainer. </dd><dt style="clear:both;"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/B0009Q0F5U/dieselhome-20/ref=nosim">Battlestar Galactica: Season One</a></dt><dd><img src="http://ec2.images-amazon.com/images/P/B0009Q0F5U.01._AA240_SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpg" alt="BSG season 1 album cover" style="float: right;" />A great show and a great soundtrack. A must for all sci-fi geeks. </dd><dt style="clear:both;"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/B000FCUYKO/dieselhome-20/ref=nosim">Battlestar Galactica: Season Two</a></dt><dd><img src="http://ec1.images-amazon.com/images/P/B000FCUYKO.01._AA240_SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpg" alt="BSG season 2 album cover" style="float: right;" />See above. I'm eagerly awaiting season 3's release. </dd><dt style="clear:both;"><a href="http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/B000BM7UBY/dieselhome-20/ref=nosim">Tropicália: A Brazilian Revolution in Sound</a></dt><dd><img src="http://ec1.images-amazon.com/images/P/B000BM7UBY.01._AA240_SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpg" alt="Tropicália album cover" style="float: right;" />I'm not much of a jazz fan, aside from the Charlie Brown music, but I love obscure stuff like this. Since I heard it sampled in a Ghostface track, I haven't been able to get <em>Alfômega - Caetano Veloso</em> out of my head. I discovered this one thanks to <a href="http://hypem.com/">the hype machine</a>. (thanks <a title="Synja" href="http://www.livejournal.com/users/synja/">Jon</a>!) At $19.99 it's kinda pricey, I was hoping it was a 2-disc set or something, but it does come with a pretty thick little booklet with more than you wanted to know about Brazilian music. </dd></dl><p style="clear:both;">I highly recommend <a href="http://www.riaaradar.com/">riaaradar.com's</a> <a href="http://www.riaaradar.com/bookmark.asp">bookmarklet</a>.</p><p>Are you boycotting the RIAA this month? If so, what independent music did you buy?</p>
bodyArticleHtml:
2007-03-10

March - A month of RIAA boycotting, and independent music supporting.
